Package: groovyJCSP

[Groovy] Class ChannelInputList

    • groovyJCSP.ChannelInputList

    • ChannelInputList is used to create a list of ChannelInputEnds

      • Properties Summary

          Properties 
          Type Name and description
          java.util.List<jcsp.lang.ChannelInput>  cList
          The list that holds the Channel Input Ends

      • Constructor Summary

          Constructors 
          Constructor and description
          ChannelInputList (jcsp.lang.One2OneChannel[] channelArray)
          ChannelInputList uses the ArrayList class of java This constructor takes an array of One2One Channels as its constructor parameter and converts them to a list of ChannelInputEnds
          ChannelInputList (jcsp.lang.One2AnyChannel[] channelArray)
          ChannelInputList uses the ArrayList class of java This constructor takes an array of One2Any Channels as its constructor parameter and converts them to a list of ChannelInputEnds
          ChannelInputList (jcsp.lang.Any2AnyChannel[] channelArray)
          ChannelInputList uses the ArrayList class of java This constructor takes an array of Any2Any Channels as its constructor parameter and converts them to a list of ChannelInputEnds
          ChannelInputList (jcsp.lang.Any2OneChannel[] channelArray)
          ChannelInputList uses the ArrayList class of java This constructor takes an array of Any2One Channels as its constructor parameter and converts them to a list of ChannelInputEnds
          ChannelInputList ()
          ChannelInputList uses the ArrayList class of java This constructor creates an empty ArrayList to be populated with NetChannelInputs or Channel Input Ends

      • Methods Summary

          Methods 
          Type Name and description
          void append(jcsp.lang.ChannelInput value)
          Appends the channel input end or net channel input to the ChannelInputList.
          boolean contains(jcsp.lang.ChannelInput value)
          The method contains determines whether or not the Channel Input List contains a specific value
          jcsp.lang.ChannelInput getAt(int index)
          This method returns the channel input end located at the subscript specified by index
          void putAt(int index, jcsp.lang.ChannelInput value)
          This method puts a channel end specified by value at the position specified by index into the channel list
          java.util.List read()
          Reads in parallel from every element if the ChannelInputList.
          java.util.List readSeq()
          The same as read except that the channels are read in sequence
          boolean remove(jcsp.lang.ChannelInput value)
          This method removes a value that is a channel input end from the list
          int size()
          Returns the length of the Channel Input List
          jcsp.lang.ChannelInput[] toArray()
          converts the ChannelInputList to an array

      • Property Detail

        • java.util.List<jcsp.lang.ChannelInput> cList

          The list that holds the Channel Input Ends

      • Constructor Detail

        • ChannelInputList(jcsp.lang.One2OneChannel[] channelArray)

          ChannelInputList uses the ArrayList class of java This constructor takes an array of One2One Channels as its constructor parameter and converts them to a list of ChannelInputEnds

          Parameters:
          channelArray - an array of channels

        • ChannelInputList(jcsp.lang.One2AnyChannel[] channelArray)

          ChannelInputList uses the ArrayList class of java This constructor takes an array of One2Any Channels as its constructor parameter and converts them to a list of ChannelInputEnds

          Parameters:
          channelArray

        • ChannelInputList(jcsp.lang.Any2AnyChannel[] channelArray)

          ChannelInputList uses the ArrayList class of java This constructor takes an array of Any2Any Channels as its constructor parameter and converts them to a list of ChannelInputEnds

          Parameters:
          channelArray

        • ChannelInputList(jcsp.lang.Any2OneChannel[] channelArray)

          ChannelInputList uses the ArrayList class of java This constructor takes an array of Any2One Channels as its constructor parameter and converts them to a list of ChannelInputEnds

          Parameters:
          channelArray

        • ChannelInputList()

          ChannelInputList uses the ArrayList class of java This constructor creates an empty ArrayList to be populated with NetChannelInputs or Channel Input Ends

      • Method Detail

        • void append(jcsp.lang.ChannelInput value)

          Appends the channel input end or net channel input to the ChannelInputList.

          Parameters:
          value - The channel end to be added to the list of channels

        • boolean contains(jcsp.lang.ChannelInput value)

          The method contains determines whether or not the Channel Input List contains a specific value

          Returns:
          a boolean such that if value is contained in the Channel Input List true is returned and false otherwise
          Parameters:
          value - The element value which is to be looked for

        • jcsp.lang.ChannelInput getAt(int index)

          This method returns the channel input end located at the subscript specified by index

          Returns:
          the ChannelInputEnd at subscript index
          Parameters:
          index - the subscript of the channel end returned form the ChannelInputList

        • void putAt(int index, jcsp.lang.ChannelInput value)

          This method puts a channel end specified by value at the position specified by index into the channel list

          Returns:
          the channel list with the element subscripted by index set to value
          Parameters:
          index - the subscript of the element to be set
          value - a channel input end

        • java.util.List read()

          Reads in parallel from every element if the ChannelInputList.

          Returns:
          a list of values one for each channel input that has been read

        • java.util.List readSeq()

          The same as read except that the channels are read in sequence

          Returns:
          a list of values one for each channel input that has been read

        • boolean remove(jcsp.lang.ChannelInput value)

          This method removes a value that is a channel input end from the list

          Returns:
          the list minus the value that has been removed
          Parameters:
          value - the channel input end to be removed

        • int size()

          Returns the length of the Channel Input List

          Returns:
          the number of elements in the Channel Input List

        • jcsp.lang.ChannelInput[] toArray()

          converts the ChannelInputList to an array

          Returns:
          the array of ChannelInputEnds
